was a pseudonym of Japanese conceptual artist (born 1937, died 26 October 2014). He started the art group Hi-Red Center with Jiro Takamatsu and Natsuyuki Nakanishi in 1963. Akasegawa helped to start the "Roadside Observation" art group (路上観察学会 in Japanese) with Terunobu Fujimori in 1986. He also created the word "Tomason" to describe a kind of found art. Tomason are parts of buildings that seem useless, but are interesting.
He used another pen name for novels. He won the Akutagawa Prize in 1981 for a short story called "Chichi ga kieta".
